channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023081037
item.description:
Report E-2023081037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023081030
item.description:
Report E-2023081030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023, at 0909 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Miami, Florida regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons combined of Tremco PUMA BC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), Tremco PUMA TC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), VULKEMÂ® 171 Primer (UN1133, Adhesive, 3, II) from (an unknown amount of) 6-gallon metal drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of the asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) roll-off by contractors which was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090049
item.description:
Report E-2023090049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1188 was mishandled by terminal personnel and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect the released product, then transferred the remaining product into one (1) new 55-gallon drum for further shipping. Utilizing hand tools, all UN1188 impacted material was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080718
item.description:
Report X-2023080718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found atop a pallet leaking badly on its bottom. The pallet was isolated and moved to the HazMat area DescribePack: The metal drum's lid was dented and partially opened within the box. The box was leaking badly on the bottom. The top of the box was not crushed or torn despite the drum inside being dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box and its pallet were isolated and moved to the HazMat area for processing. Paper towels were used to clean up the paint and identify the product. The product was difficult to read due to paint spill.

item.title: Report X-2023080363
item.description:
Report X-2023080363

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: STUART
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AS THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED OUT OF THE FEEDER AND PLACED ON THE BELT A PRELOADER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. HE NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR WHO WAS AN RMP. THEY STOPPED MOVEMENT ON THE PACKAGE AND PLACED IT IN A SPILL TRAY. A HAZ MAT RESPONSDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH DMP AND DISCOVERED UNECLARED.
